result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A. Baumbach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to obtain/maintain full time employment suitable to agent and may not quit employment unless approved by agent.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Engage in parenting classes and follow through with any recommendations.

Domestic abuse classes and follow through with any recommendations.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.

May not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription in own name and take as prescribed by a licensed provider.

May not possess drug paraphernalia.

May not be present where controlled substances are illegally sold or consumed.

May not have contact with known drug dealers or drug users or their residences.

Follow any rules and conditions per agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

supervisions.notes:
**1/23/2017  - JOC amended to reflect 128 days of sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 15CF204

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment suitable to agent and may not quit employment unless approved by agent.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name and take prescribed medications as prescribed.

No drug paraphernalia.

Not be present where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

Not associate with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

Complete AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommendations.

Complete domestic violence assessment and comply with any treatment recommendations.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.

Obey all no contacts per agent.

Comply with any assessments or conditions per agent.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob A. Baumbach
